Description: Length of narrow ribbon, red wool with blue stripes at sides, brocaded design in undyed linen; Down centre two repeating motifs, a small plant and a pointed leaf, dotted pattern in borders; Warp: S spun Z ply wool. c.13tp; Weft: S spun wool and linen, c.9tpc main weft, brocading in S spun undyed linen, grouped by 6), one group of linen threads per shed of main weft, floating over 2,4 or 6 warp ends; Edges: two simple selvedges, one end cut the other ragged
Curator's comments: Unreg 45; Similar to EA72425; Found 1988? in Keeper's Office, previous location cupboard O; Originally applied by sewing to the edges of a garment and woven for this purpose; Looks as though, on the back, that some of the long floating threads were clipped deliberately; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (22.3.1991)
Condition: Fair; Linen discoloured and in places perished
